places.name: Kigali Genocide Memorial
places.description: A moving memorial and museum honoring victims of the 1994 genocide, featuring exhibits, archives, and peaceful gardens.

places.name: Nyamirambo Women’s Center Walking Tour
places.description: Guided walking tour through Nyamirambo, Kigali’s oldest neighborhood, showcasing markets, local food, culture, and daily life.

places.name: Kandt House Museum
places.description: Former residence of German explorer Richard Kandt, featuring Rwanda’s colonial history, natural history exhibits, and live reptiles.

places.name: Mount Kigali Hike
places.description: A scenic hike offering panoramic views of Kigali city and surrounding countryside, popular with locals and visitors alike.

places.name: Kimironko Market
places.description: Bustling local market known for fabrics, crafts, produce, and fresh food stalls. A lively experience of Kigali’s daily life.

places.name: Inema Arts Center
places.description: One of East Africa’s biggest contemporary art galleries, showcasing paintings, sculptures, and performances by Rwandan artists.

places.name: Kigali Convention Centre
places.cost: Free to view (restaurants, events priced separately)
places.description: Iconic dome-shaped landmark and event space, beautifully lit at night, with restaurants and Kigali Heights nearby.

places.name: Kigali Nightlife & Live Music
places.description: Vibrant nightlife scene with rooftop bars, lounges, live music, and traditional dance performances.

places.name: Question Coffee Café
places.description: Specialty café serving Rwanda’s finest coffee, with workshops and tastings to learn about Rwanda’s coffee culture.

places.name: Fazenda Sengha (Horseback Riding & Outdoor Activities)
places.description: Outdoor recreation center offering horseback riding, zip-lining, archery, and picnics with great views of Kigali.
